meanings.definition: Make a quick, nervous movement of the face or body as an instinctive reaction to surprise, fear, or pain.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't help flinching when the loud thunder startled her.
meanings.sent2: The cat kept flinching every time a car honked outside.
meanings.sent3: Seeing a spider made him flinch comically, jumping back in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The sudden burst of fireworks made the dog flinch as if under attack.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the door slamming shut made her flinch involuntarily.

meanings.definition: Show fear or unease in a way that is noticeable.
meanings.sent1: He was flinching at the thought of giving a speech in front of the whole class.
meanings.sent2: The child was flinching as he approached the dark, spooky basement.
meanings.sent3: She pretended to be brave, but her flinching eyes betrayed her true feelings.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence of the abandoned house had everyone flinching with fear.
meanings.sent5: The menacing growl of the bear had the hikers flinching in terror.
